Proverbs__05.1: My son, attend to my wisdom, and incline thy ear to my prudence.
Proverbs__05.2: That thou mayst keep thoughts, and thy lips may preserve instruction. Mind not the deceit of a woman.
Proverbs__05.3: For the lips of a harlot are like a honeycomb dropping, and her throat is smoother than oil.
Proverbs__05.4: But her end is bitter as wormwood, and sharp as a two-edged sword.
Proverbs__05.5: Her feet go down into death, and her steps go in as far as hell.
Proverbs__05.6: They walk not by the path of life, her steps are wandering, and unaccountable.
Proverbs__05.7: Now therefore, my son, hear me, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
Proverbs__05.8: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the doors of her house.
Proverbs__05.9: Give not thy honour to strangers, and thy years to the cruel.
Proverbs__05.10: Lest strangers be filled with thy strength, and thy labours be in another man's house,
Proverbs__05.11: And thou mourn it the last, when thou shalt have spent thy flesh and thy body, and say:
Proverbs__05.12: Why have I hated instruction, and my heart consented not to reproof,
Proverbs__05.13: And have not heard the voice of them that taught me, and have not inclined my ear to masters?
Proverbs__05.14: I have almost been in all evil, in the midst of the church and of the congregation.
Proverbs__05.15: Drink water out of thy own cistern, and the streams of thy own well:
Proverbs__05.16: Let thy fountains be conveyed abroad, and in the streets divide thy waters.
Proverbs__05.17: Keep them to thyself alone, neither let strangers be partakers with thee.
Proverbs__05.18: Let thy vein be blessed, and rejoice with the wife of thy youth:
Proverbs__05.19: Let her be thy dearest hind, and most agreeable fawn: let her breasts inebriate thee at all times; be thou delighted continually with her love.
Proverbs__05.20: Why art thou seduced, my son, by a strange woman, and art cherished in the bosom of another?
Proverbs__05.21: The Lord beholdeth the ways of man, and considereth all his steps.
Proverbs__05.22: His own iniquities catch the wicked, and he is fast bound with the ropes of his own sins.
Proverbs__05.23: He shall die, because he hath not received instruction, and in the multitude of his folly he shall be deceived.
